plots: the player is a new member of the Fighters Guild
title: Unfinished Business
objective: find out why Maglir has defaulted on a contract
description:
I'm the Fighters Guild Champion, Modryn Oreyn, as you should know. What do you want? I suppose you've come looking for duties?
I want you to contact Maglir. He's one of your Fighters Guild brothers, but he's defaulted on a contract. We can't allow that. Makes us all look bad. He didn't finish out a contract in Skingrad. Suppose I shouldn't be surprised. He's raw, like you. Go and find out what's wrong with him.

plots: Irlav Jarol and his group of mages want to use the Bloodworm Helm to fight Mannimarco
Arch-Mage Traven fears that necromancers might target Irlav Jarol
title: The Bloodworm Helm
objective: return the Bloodworm Helm to the Arcane University
tasks: find Irlav Jarol, his group of mages, and the Bloodworm Helm
description:
A group of mages led by Irlav Jarol took the Bloodworm Helm, and have retreated to Fort Teleman, in an effort to study it further.
They hope to learn enough from it to find some sort of way to fight Mannimarco. I tried to dissuade them, but it was no use.
I would like the helm to be returned, so that it may be kept safe here in the Arcane University. I fear Irlav has made himself a target for the Necromancers.

plots: Argonians are unpredictable opponents, especially near water
title: Swim for Your Life
objective: assassinate Deekus
description:
There's an assassination contract for you. You are to kill Deekus.
He is an Argonian layabout, likes to scavenge shipwrecks. My guess is he'll run if threatened. Or swim, if given the chance.
Personally, I've always found Argonians to be incredibly unpredictable opponents. Especially near water. Unfortunately, Deekus is at Hela's Folly, a small waterlogged shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar. Making him stay out of water will be difficult.

plots: NONE
title: Andurs' Arkay Amulet
objective: retrieve Andurs' amulet of Arkay
tasks: search for Andurs' amulet of Arkay
description:
Perhaps you'll take pity on a humble priest who has lost something precious?
I lost my amulet of Arkay. It's the source of my divine powers and also a sacred badge of office. I misplaced it in the catacombs. I'd look for it, but I've been hearing noises down there. I fear the dead have become... restless. Without that amulet, I'm powerless to confront them.
Would you be willing to search for it? I'll just wait here and make sure nothing foul escapes the catacombs.

plots: the Professor sent the player after the power source in the Scrapworks: the Officer and his troop are on the same mission
the Officer sent his troop to the Abandoned Sawmill: he has not heard from them
title: The Cave-In
objective: clear the way to the Scrapworks
description:
So, the Professor sent you after the Power Source? We were on the same mission, but the only way to the Scrapworks is through that pile of rock.
I know the Abandoned Sawmill used to have plenty of explosives from when the place was still in operation - a little bit of dynamite would probably get the job done here.
I sent my troop after it, but haven't heard a thing. If you can head up there and get that dynamite, we could all pass through and get the Professor what he needs.

plots: Hieronymus Lex and the Imperial Watch have invaded the Imperial City Waterfront: Hieronymus Lex has vowed not to leave until the Gray Fox is in custody
title: Misdirection
objective: help the Thieves Guild get the Imperial City Waterfront back to normal
tasks: find Methredhel, who is co-ordinating the Thieves Guild's response
description:
I have a small problem that you may be able to help with. The guild will even pay a reward.
That buffoon, Hieronymus Lex, has invaded the Imperial City Waterfront. Imperial Watch guards from all over the city prowl the streets. Hieronymus Lex has vowed not to leave until the Gray Fox is in custody. The Fox is safe, but the Thieves Guild cannot do business like this. The poor of the Waterfront are kindred to the Gray Fox, and will not betray him. However, cubs soon get hungry. Soon someone will break. Many guild members could be jailed.
Find Methredhel in the Imperial City. She is co-ordinating the guild's response. Shadow hide the hunter.

plots: the player has done assignments to Bodhi before

Bodhi gives the player a cloak and a dagger to implicate the Shadow Thieves: when Senior Armagaran Vulova is dead, the player must put the cloak and the dagger in the fountain in Senior Armagaran Vulova's house
title: A Misguided Murder
objective: pin the murder of Senior Armagaran Vulova on the Shadow Thieves
description:
Now I ask for a more specific task that will disrupt the Shadow Thieves further.
The task is... unseemly.
It calls for the murder of a man. Not a truly innocent man, but hardly a villain of epic scope. You must kill, blaming the murder on the Shadow Thieves. He is head of a merchant house, and his link to Shadow Thieves is blatant. If he were to die and certain gear were at the scene, it would implicate the guild we oppose.
Take this cloak and dagger, and go kill Senior Armagaran Vulova. When he is dead, put the cloak and dagger in the fountain in his house. He will die easily, though there may be guards. His small house is in the Government District, between the jail and the government building.
Go.

plots: Dryad of the Cloud Peaks dies if her ancient oak dies
title: Dryad of the Cloud Peaks
objective: save Dryad of the Cloud Peaks' ancient oak from dying
tasks: stop a pair of people from attacking Dryad of the Cloud Peaks' ancient oak
description:
Please, kind spirits, a wondrous ancient oak is in peril. It is the tree to which I am bonded! If it dies, I, Dryad of the Cloud Peaks, die.
It is about to be attacked by two who would defile the majesty of nature. They have avoided my charms and must be stopped before irreparable harm is done. Would you heed my plea?
There is a potion that might help you on your journeys.

plots: NONE
title: Cleansing Light
objective: destroy the head vampire to scatter its minions
description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a vampire lair at Movarth's Lair.
Destroying the head vampire is usually sufficient to scatter its minions, though it's best to destroy every last one of them.
I suspect there's more wherever he came from. We cannot afford to relax.

TL2126: Warbeast den, in the Bone Defile
TL2128: Warbeast den, in the Bone Defile

plots: NONE
title: Angry Beasts
objective: calm down the Warbeasts
tasks: get rid of whatever's making the Warbeasts vicious
description:
I've been charged with culling the Warbeasts here, for the Imperial colonization effort. I can keep their population down, but something is driving them wild, almost like they're rabid or something.
Can you get into the Warbeast den, in the Bone Defile, and get rid of whatever's making them so vicious?

plots: the player has met the spirit of the grove before
the player is a child of nature: a druid
Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods
Marek of Halruaa's old enemies have returned to haunt his descendants: Loren's parents were killed by an evil that haunts him
title: Rescue Loren
objective: aid the spirit of Marek of Halruaa in saving Loren
tasks: save Loren from Marek of Halruaa's old enemies
description:
It is I, the spirit of the grove, child.
Child of nature, you are again needed. Balance is threatened, and Chaos is at the periphery. Will you serve the grove?
The grove is young in terms of nature and ancient in the years of man. Centuries ago, Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods. Now, as Marek knew would someday happen, his descendants have returned and old enemies marshal their forces. A child called Loren has recently arrived in Trademeet. This child is the inheritor of Marek's spirit, but does not yet have the knowledge to use his power. Surely he shall be slain by the forces of chaos if you do not rescue him. Even now he is alone and in danger, his parents slain by an evil that haunts him. You must find the child Loren in Trademeet and fight Marek's old enemies to save the child's life.
The spirit that once was Marek has gone forth to aid the child... but the spirit is not the power that the man once was and cannot hope to hold out for long. Aid him lest all be lost.

plots: the player has summoned Fade: the player wants to enter Cacklespit's Realm
title: Cacklespit's Realm
objective: bring 4 skulls of famous warriors to Fade
description:
I am Fade - why have you summoned me?
Ah, you want to enter Cacklespit's hidden realm. Yes, I know the way - but I do not provide service without compensation.
I have very particular... appetites. The remains of the living are infused with a lingering residue of deeds past, which sustains me. Bring me the skulls of four warriors of renown, and I will take you where you wish to go. This battlefield is littered with the bones of great heroes. Your search should not be difficult.

plots: Therndle Daglefodd cannot work without knowing his sons fate
title: A Son Missing
objective: find out what happened to Bedlen Daglefodd
description:
I'm Therndle Daglefodd, a merchant.
My child, Bedlen Daglefodd, has been missing for a tunnel's worth of digging. I simply cannot work without knowing his fate.
Could you have a look for him?

plots: Tolfdir and the others can't crack Ancano's magical shield around the College of Winterhold
the player got the Staff of Magnus the Labyrinthian
title: The Eye of Magnus
objective: force Ancano stop exploiting the Eye of Magnus
tasks: get inside the College of Winterhold with the Staff of Magnus and reach Ancano
description:
Ancano has sealed himself inside the College! The Eye of Magnus is is growing his power. We can't crack whatever magic he's using to shield himself.
I hope your trip to Labyrinthian was worth it. You have the Staff of Magnus, then? Let's hope it's as powerful as the Psijics believe it to be.
You're the one with the staff, my child. If it can help us get inside the College, and reach Ancano, we'll have to hope that there's a way to stop all this.

plots: the player has served other Daedric Princes
Hermaeus Mora's followers need souls: Hermaeus Mora gives the player a spell to trap souls
title: Hermaeus Mora, the Collector of Souls
objective: return to Hermaeus Mora with the souls of the ten sentient races of Tamriel
tasks: capture one soul from each of the ten sentient races of Tamriel
description:
I see you have served my brethren, and now you come to serve me. I am Hermaeus Mora. Past, present, and future are as one to me.
My followers seek to perform a divination. For this, they need souls, one of each of the ten sentient races of Tamriel. You will provide these souls. I give you a spell to trap these souls. Return to me when you have finished. When you do, I will further your journey on your true path.
Do your service onto me and I give you this, the Oghma Infinium. Knowledge given by me to Xarxes is recorded within.

plots: the player purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall
title: Helping Hands
objective: hire a housekeeper for Rosethorn Hall
tasks: pay Eyja 150 gold to hire her as your housekeeper
description:
Hello, I heard you purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall, and I was wondering if you had anyone in mind to fill that position?
For 150 gold and a roof over my head, I'm yours. Well, to help around the house I mean.

plots: if the player bumps into Indaryn, they should not tell him anything about Romlyn Dreth's dealings
title: Under the Table
objective: make a delivery for Romlyn Dreth
tasks: smuggle a small Black-Briar Mead keg to Wilhelm
description:
I'm not selling cheap mead. I'm selling good mead for cheap... Black-Briar Mead. I sell cases of it for half of what the inns and taverns pay through the Black-Briar Meadery.
If anyone saw me leave Riften, they'd get suspicious. I need someone to take this small keg of Black-Briar Mead to Wilhelm at the Vilemyr Inn in Ivarstead. Drop it off and he'll trade you something for the delivery. Keep it as payment for the legwork.
Oh, and if you bump into Indaryn from the meadery, keep your mouth shut. He'd rat us out in a second.

plots: Yago has cursed Namara: Brielbara can undo the curse with Yago's spellbook
title: Brielbara's Baby
objective: bring Yago's spellbook to Brielbara
description:
Travelers! I am Brielbara, a mage of minor power.
I'll pay you 200 gold, not much for heroic adventurers, but all that I have.
An evil mage has laid a curse upon my only child, Namara. She is slowly wasting away and, without help, she'll die. The mage who did this is named Yago, and I'm sure that he possesses the remedy to the curse. Would you track him down for me, please? He's been staying at a place called the Low Lantern. It's the playground for the wicked and depraved, a ship where prostitutes ply their trade. All I want you to do is find him and take his spellbook. I have enough magical skill to reverse the curse if I had the formula for his spell.

plots: the Bravil city watch is useless: they can't catch the 4 escaped prison fugitives
title: The Fugitives
objective: find 4 escaped prison fugitives that have been causing trouble near Bravil
tasks: ask people about the 4 escaped prison fugitives
description:
I've got something for you. Could be tough. There are some escaped fugitives for you to find, meat.
Some real hard cases got out of the Bravil prison. Been terrorizing the locals ever since. The Watch is useless, so we step in.
Apparently, there are three or four of them. Real nasty, from what I hear. You take care of them. Maybe you'll get lucky and they'll surrender.
The people of Bravil aren't talking, but you might try asking around, butter them up a bit.
Get to it.

plots: Hareph sent the player to find his demolition crew: he gave the player explosives
some Skara hives seem to be infected with something
title: Blight of the Bugs
objective: discover what has been blighting Skara eggs
tasks: find the rigged Skara hives and detonate them
description:
Ah, Hareph sent you with some explosives. Finally some good news!
Don't bother looking for the rest of the crew - I'm the only one that survived. 
There's something wrong with some of the Skara hives - they seem to be infected. You'll need to locate the rigged hives and detonate them, then descend into the Brood Hive itself and destroy any infected eggs you find. Perhaps you will discover what has been blighting the eggs!
This is a great task, but it must be done. We will all be in your debt.

plots: Anonymous found the missing students of the College of Winterhold dead in the Midden: they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities
the Deadric Relic in the Midden is related to the students' death: Anonymous pried 4 rings from the Deadric Relic
title: Forgotten Names
objective: complete a summoning ritual in the Midden
tasks: find the 4 rings needed in the ritual
description:
Midden Incident Report
by Anonymous

The missing students were found in the Midden this morning. Dead, as expected. None of us bothered keeping a detect life charm for the search at this point.
The bodies were found together, each suffering the same deformities; peeled and bubbling skin on the arms and face. Conjurer's burn, as it's commonly referred to around the College. There's little doubt they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities.
The relic nearby put any doubt in this theory to rest. I admit that I've never seen one like it - a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm. Attempts to move it were in vain. I must show it to the Archmage during his upcoming visit. Perhaps he will know more.
While we couldn't move the relic, I was able to pry four "rings" from it. I'm sure there's a connection between them and the ritual the students were attempting.
I'll store these in the Arcanaeum until we can consult with a conjuration master to learn more.

plots: NONE
title: A Corpse for Arkion
objective: bring a corpse to Arkion
description:
The name's Arkion.
I've got a dirty deed fer ya. How 'bout you go down into the sewers and bring me up a body. Now, I don't ask questions 'bout how you come 'bout them and I don't want any questions 'bout what I use 'em fer. Bring 'em to me when ya find 'em.
There'll be 250 gold pieces to relieve the stink of it all.

plots: Wyndelius went into Shroud Hearth Barrow two years ago: Wilhelm warned him not to go in there
Wyndelius was never seen again
title: Lifting the Shroud
objective: investigate Shroud Hearth Barrow
description:
If I were you, I'd keep away from the barrow on the east side of town...
There ain't much more to tell... it's haunted and you should stay away. Look, I've seen one of the spirits with my very own eyes. When it glared at me, I swear it burned right through my soul.
Fortunately, the spirits seem to be sticking to the barrow. I think they're guarding it. Certainly isn't helping my business any; who'd want to rent a room anywhere near a haunted barrow?
If you think there's anything you can do, be my guest. About a year or two ago, some fella named Wyndelius came through; said he was some kind of a treasure hunter. I warned him not to go in there, just like I warned you. The very next night we heard screams from the barrow, and that was it. We never saw him again.

plots: Elenwen regularly throws parties: while the player is talking with Malborn, Delphine gets the player an invitation to one of Elenwen's parties
title: Diplomatic Immunity
objective: infiltrate the party at the Thalmor Embassy, and find Elenwen's secret files
description:
The Thalmor ambassador, Elenwen, regularly throws parties where the rich and connected cozy up to the Thalmor.
I can get you into one of those parties. Once you're inside the Embassy, you get away and find Elenwen's secret files. I have a contact inside the Embassy. He's not up for this kind of high-risk mission, but he can help you. His name's Malborn. Wood elf, plenty of reason to hate the Thalmor. You can trust him.
I'll get word for him to meet you in Solitude, at the Winking Skeever -- you know it? While you're doing that, I'll work on getting you an invitation to Elenwen's little party.
Meet me at the Solitude stables after you've arranged things with Malborn.

plots: guards do not let anyone in the circus tent
title: Find Giran's Mother Within the Circus Tent
objective: investigate the circus tent
description:
sniff* My momma's still inside. They says she can't come out. My momma went into the tent to see a circus show. But somethin' happened, and now nobody comes out. There's guards who won't let nobody in anymore, too. But my momma's in there!
I want my momma! Please find her, please!

plots: the passage to Vahlok's Tomb must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions
title: Lost Legacy
objective: protect Tharstan while he researches an old tomb
description:
Yes, I think you're just the adventurous sort I need. I have a job offer for you.
As a scholar of history, I've always found Solstheim to be most intriguing. I've made many forays into the ancient ruins that cover the island. I've come to know those ruins so well, I could draw you a map from memory. That's why I noticed the new passage the moment I laid eyes on it.
it leads to an old tomb, I think. It must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions. I'd love to have a closer look, but those old ruins can be dangerous and I'm no adventurer. I'll pay you to watch my back down there.
I'll be heading back there soon. If you're interested, meet me at the ruins and we'll see what we can find. Now I'm off to pack for the expedition!

plots: NONE
title: The Path of Dawn
objective: recover the Amulet of Kings before the assassins take it out of you and Jauffre's reach
tasks: Go to Luther Broad's Boarding House.
description:
We must try to recover the Amulet before the enemy takes it out of our reach. You should go back to the Imperial City. Baurus may have learned something about the assassins.
You'll find Baurus at Luther Broad's Boarding House in the Elven Gardens district of the Imperial City.

plots: Pyke made his way to the Shivering Isles as soon as he heard the gates to the Shivering Isles open
Pyke will mark the Fetid Grove on the player's map
title: To Help A Hero
objective: bring Pyke's gold medallion back to him
tasks: retrieve Pyke's gold medallion from Grummites
description:
It's good to meet you. The name's Pyke, and I welcome you to my humble home. Please, make yourself comfortable.
Since you're here, I was wondering... do you think you could assist me? I'm having a bit of a crisis.
I was a Knight of the Thorn from Cyrodiil. As soon as I heard the gates to the Shivering Isles opened, I knew a threat was lurking inside. I made my way here and began exploring this strange place. As I was passing Fetid Grove, I was waylaid. Some dastardly Grummites stole my most prized possession... my medallion that signified my membership in the Knights. It's a small, round, gold medallion. On the back is the inscription "To Pyke, from Farwil".
Could you bring back my medallion from the Grummites at Fetid Grove? I will mark Fetid Grove on your map. You could have Thorn Shield as a reward. Good luck to you, friend!

plots: the Council of Mages is investigating what happened at Wellspring Cave, leaving the ranks of Mages Guild spread thin
Skingrad is an unusual place
title: Ulterior Motives
objective: retrieve a book from Janus Hassildor
description:
I, Raminus Polus, have a new task for you.
The Council is investigating what happened at Wellspring Cave. Many of our resources are devoted to the task, leaving our ranks spread thin. There is a related book that needs to be recovered. It was recently loaned to Janus Hassildor, the Count of Skingrad. I'd like you to retrieve it.
I understand this may not seem the most important of tasks, but still... it needs doing, and you are one of the few available to do it. A note of caution: Skingrad is an... unusual place. Be prepared for the unexpected.
The city of Skingrad lies southwest of the Imperial City. You should have no trouble finding it.
You have your task. Perform it as well as you would any other.

plots: Roggvir died: Svari's mother took his death hard
title: Return to Grace
objective: convince Svari's mother to go to temple
description:
Mum doesn't say much since Uncle Roggvir died. She doesn't even go to temple anymore. I wish she would. At least that way she'd have people to talk to.
Maybe you could convince her. You should go do it right now.

plots: NONE
title: Preemptive Strike
objective: destroy a vampire before it turns its bandit allies into vampires
description:
I've found another beast hiding from the light of day.
We need to destroy him before he turns his comrades into a brood of vampires. He's holed up in Treva's Watch with a group of a bandits.

plots: after the Oblivion crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn: one of the groups found Mehrunes' Razor and split it into three fragments almost 150 years ago
the descendants of the group still have the fragments of Mehrunes' Razor: Silus Vesuius gives the player his notes on the owners
title: Pieces of the Past
objective: retrieve the scattered pieces of Mehrunes' Razor for Silus Vesuius
tasks: find Ghunzul, Drascua, and Jorgen, the owners of the pieces of Mehrunes' Razor
description:
I have a job you look perfect for.
A little history, first. After the Oblivion Crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn. One of these groups found Mehrunes' Razor, the artifact of Mehrunes Dagon. They split it into three fragments and pledged to keep them apart forever. That was almost 150 years ago, and the pieces are still being kept by the descendants of that group. And they're right here, in Skyrim.
At least two of the owners, Ghunzul and Drascua, are dangerous marauders. And the third owner, Jorgen, I only know he lives in Morthal.
Here are my notes about them. I'll gladly pay you for getting the pieces any way you can. No questions asked.

plots: Fazeer Shah and Ezrek Khan went to war centuries ago: they damaged the cities and devastated the land; Zeraphi sultan had enough and banished them both
title: Meet the Djinni
objective: convince Fazeer Shah to help you
description:
Centuries ago, a djinni named Fazeer Shah and a djinni named Ezrek Khan quarreled over some trivial matter, and ultimately went to war. They caused considerable damage to the cities, and devastated the land, until the Zeraphi sultan had had enough. He banished them both: one to the desert, and one to... another place; a dark realm.
If you can reach Fazeer Shah, you might be able to convince him to help us.
You must travel out into the Salt Barrens to locate Fazeer Shah.

plots: magic is hated in Amn
Valygar Corthala has murdered two Cowled Wizards: he is currently in hiding
Valygar Corthala's friends and servants will not speak to Cowled Wizards
title: The Hunt for Valygar Corthala
objective: deliver Valygar Corthala to the Cowled Wizards dead or alive
description:
I am Tolgerias, a proud member of the Amnian Cowled Wizards.
This matter must be handled with discretion and expediency. There is something that has been plaguing us for more than a week now and has become quite alarming.
You know of the prevailing attitude against magic here in Amn, yes? Well, amongst some it is even worse than that... a burning, palpable hatred. One particular man here in Athkatla has murdered two of our number in cold blood. He is currently in hiding, and we need you to track the fellow down. We have been unable to do so, much to our frustration. Cowled Wizards cannot be assaulted without repercussions or it will lead to... serious problems.
He is Valygar Corthala, last son of a wealthy family and a true brute. Ask around and you may discover if he is hiding within the city or someplace else. He has a home here in the Docks District, or he may have fled to the Umar Hills. His friends and servants will not speak to us, but they may to you.
We do not ask that you commit any murder. We wish Valygar be delivered to us, that is all. He will likely resist, so if you must kill him, so be it. But if you do kill him, I simply must have his body. Valygar must be delivered to us whether he is dead or alive. You understand, yes?

plots: Sheogorath does not know how much time he has left: Sheogorath wants the Gatekeeper to guard the Gates and be ready for Jyggalag's forces
the player should tell Relmyna that they are working for Sheogorath: Relmyna would do anything for Sheogorath
title: Rebuilding the Gatekeeper
objective: rebuild the Gatekeeper
description:
Things are getting a bit thin. Get that Gatekeeper in place, and do it quickly. I'm not sure how much time I have left.
It's essential. Simply essential! If only it were essentially simple... but it's not. I want him there guarding those Gates. If any of Jyggalag's forces show up, he should be ready for them.
It wouldn't do to just let them in if more show up. And more always show up. Still and all, I think things are going well, considering! Go talk to Relmyna in Xaselm. Tell her you're working for me. She'd do anything for me, that little minx.

plots: Delon does not have any money
Delon was sent to find someone who could help his home village Imnesvale: terrible beasts have been seen out in the hills
Umar herself might have returned
Minister Lloyd can tell everything else
title: Investigate the Deaths in the Umar Hills
objective: investigate the monster sightings at Imnesvale
description:
My name's Delon. I was sent to f-find someone, but things have been gone all wrong! *sniffle* I've had all my money stolen, and I'm lost, and everyone's so mean. *sniff*
I was sent to find someone who could h-help my village, Imnesvale. Terrible things are happening there, and nobody knows what to do! Everyone says they seen strange b-beasts out in the hills. Everyone's so frightened! There's even t-t-talk that Umar herself has returned!
When you get to Imnesvale, talk to Minister Lloyd! He can tell you everything else!

plots: Marlowe requested the player to see him before
Vongoethe chased Marlowe and Malla here
Vongoethe desired Malla's soul: he stole it
Malla lies near death, and there is nothing the local priestess can do to help her
the monks sealed off the cavern rather than getting Marlowe's daughter's soul
the guard guarding the cavern will let in whomever Marlowe asks
title: The Graveyard Lich
objective: save Malla by returning her soul to her
description:
Welcome to my humble accommodations, adventurer. Will you hear out my tale?
As I said before, my name is Marlowe... I hail from Calimshan to the south, where I was a merchant. A successful one. I... suppose that is where I first came into contact with Vongoethe.
Vongoethe is a lich, adventurer. A powerful one. In Calimshan, there are many strange wonders of magic, and Vongoethe is not out of place. It is he who has chased us here, hunting us mercilessly. Vongoethe desired my poor Malla, my daughter. She is the young woman here on the bed. A... a good girl, a virgin and pure of heart. He desired her soul, he said, so I fled Calimshan with her. But he caught up to us nevertheless. And somehow he has taken her soul despite my efforts! She... she lies near death, and there is nothing the local priestess can do to help her. I know Vongoethe is in the cavern that serves as a graveyard in this place. I told the monks about him... but they sealed off the cavern rather than somehow getting my daughter's soul back as I had hoped.
Malla is the world to me! And I do not know how much longer Vongoethe will remain trapped in that cavern... he could already be loose! He will kill me and keep Malla's soul, I am sure of it!
Getting inside the cavern is not a problem. I... paid the guard there what little money I have left. I had thought to... try and get Malla's soul myself. But the guard will let in whomever I ask him to.
I have no coin left to offer you. I have bankrupted myself in trying to flee the lich's reach. But... Vongoethe himself is a powerful wizard. Surely he has items that would interest you, that you could take from him!

plots: NONE
title: Surgery
objective: change your appearance
tasks: give 1,000 gold to the flesh sculptor for her services
description:
Are you interested in my services? I warn you, my skills do not come cheaply.
Hmm, I suppose I can work with your face. After all, the sculptor cannot always choose the finest clay.
Shall I remake your face?  It is no small thing to submit yourself to the flesh sculptor's knife. Just give me 1,000 gold and tell me what you desire - beauty or hideous deformity, nothing is beyond my skill.

plots: NONE
title: Kill Roger's Sea Troll
objective: kill the sea troll
description:
Hmmn. I don't remember seeing you down here before. Me name be Roger.
Oh, the sewers aren't so terrible. The guards don't be comin' down here, and my customers like to be somewhere... out of sight. 'Tis the beasties that are the biggest problem, especially of late. There's this sea troll. People have 'em as pets, and when they grow too large, they huck 'em down here to torment me.
I suppose I could part with a few coins for the deed. I tell you what... dispose of the sea troll beastie for me, an' I'll be pleased to pay you 500 gold pieces, aye?

plots: Serana has a large Elder Scroll on her back: Serana's Elder Scroll will have something that can help the player and Serana stop Serana's father
the moth priests of Cyrodiil are the only people who can read Elder Scrolls
title: Prophet
objective: find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
tasks: ask the wizards about reading Elder Scrolls
description:
So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have an Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father. But of course, neither of us can read it.
The Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards there know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.

plots: NONE
title: The Fate of the Skaal
objective: free the Skaal at the Wind Stone from control
tasks: learn the word of power that Miraak learned long ago
use the word of power on the Wind Stone
description:
Our time here is running out. The few of us left free of control cannot protect ourselves for much longer.
You must go to Saering's Watch. Learn there the Word of Power that Miraak learned long ago, and use that knowledge on the Wind Stone.
You may be able to break the hold on our people there, and free them from control.

plots: the ash storms fill up Kolbjorn Barrow faster than Ralis Sedarys can dig
title: Unearthed
objective: become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
tasks: give 1,000 gold to Ralis Sedarys so that he can hire some diggers from Raven Rock to dig up Kolbjorn Barrow
description:
The name's Ralis. Ralis Sedarys, out of Mournhold.
I've got a financier waiting for me back on the mainland. Sent me here in the interests of obtaining some rare antiquities. The 'Relics of Ahzidal.' But this whole thing became a disaster right quick, let me tell you.
You come out to the northern ashlands, you don't expect things to go easy, you know? But this was something outside my particular expertise. When I first got to Kolbjorn, you couldn't even see it. Buried in the ash, like most other things on this blasted island. Dug out a pile of the stuff taller than me just to find the barrow. Who knows how much to reach the door. Excavating isn't exactly my specialty. Even if it was, the ash storms fill it in faster than you can dig.
Could you become my business partner? We can sort out the details of our little arrangement later, but for now, I'll manage the dig if you can manage the coin.
When you have 1,000 gold for me, I'll head back to Raven Rock and round up some diggers. Once we've got something worth looking at, I'll send word to you.

plots: Potema was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago: Styrr has a book about Potema
one of Potema's servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines
the player was there when Potema was summoned in spirit form
Styrr helps the player with Potema's minions
title: The Wolf Queen Awakened
objective: stop Potema from returning to the living
tasks: find Potema's skeleton and remove it from the catacombs
bring Potema's skeleton back to be sanctified by Arkay
description:
Ah Potema, the Wolf Queen. Former queen of Solitude and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history. She was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago. I believe I have a book about her...
And now Potema has been summoned in spirit form. Summoned in spirit form is not raised from the dead. She'll need help before she can return to the living.
For the moment, the Wolf Queen has retreated to a place filled with dead eager to serve her. She has gone to her old Catacombs. A few days ago, one of her servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines. We'll need you to go into the Catacombs themselves.
You were there when Potema was summoned. Being at the summoning created a connection to Potema, you are the one to stop her from returning to the living. I can provide you with some help with her minions.
As to Potema herself, find what's left of her body, likely a skeleton. Remove it from the Catacombs and bring it back to be sanctified by Arkay.

plots: Orthorn stole books from Urag gro-Shub and left to join the summoners at Fellglow Keep
title: Hitting the Books
objective: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
description:
I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh? Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering. I think one of those volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.

plots: NONE
title: The Desolate Mine
objective: complete your contract
description:
You here looking for work, meat? Maybe you want a contract?
I suppose I've got something for you. We need a weapons shipment delivered to Desolate Mine. That's your job.
Move your ass, boot.

plots: the player is the hero of Skyrim
title: Reluctant Steward
objective: tell Varona that Neloth wants apple cabbage stew with some canis root tea
description:
Where is that ash sucking steward of mine? Varona! Have you seen Varona? I'm hungry.
Find her. Tell her I want apple cabbage stew, with some canis root tea. After all, I don't make my own tea. I am a master wizard of the house Telvanni. Other people make tea for me.
You are not my servant? Obviously not, or you would have a cup of tea in your hands. I supposed you want to be asked nicely. Very well.
Please, oh hero of Skyrim. Please find Varona. I shall be ever so grateful.

plots: NONE
title: Lair of the Manticore
objective: bring the skin of the Manticore to the Sphinx
description:
My ancient charge, to guard the gate
The desert sands to contemplate.
In Stygian realm lurks beast of yore
Part drake, part lion: Manticore.
Lay its skin before my eyes
And passage through shall be your prize.

plots: NONE
title: Delivery to Calcelmo
objective: deliver a ring to Calcelmo for Kerah
description:
My family came here centuries ago. We've made a good living smithing the silver that flows through the city. But you probably wanted to know about the fancy carvings and stonework, didn't you? Travelers always do.
Here, I have a delivery I need to make to Calcelmo in Understone Keep. Why don't you take the ring to him? He knows the history of Markarth better than anyone. He can be a bit difficult, but I'm sure he'll appreciate your help.

plots: NONE
title: The Museum of Oddities
objective: bring anything unusual, bizarre, strange, or disturbing to Una Armina
tasks: find Oddities for the Museum of Oddities
description:
Hello, I'm Una Armina. Perhaps you've heard of my Museum of Oddities? There you can view all the finest Oddities of the Realm.
I'm always looking for new exhibits, so be sure to think of me when you see anything Odd! I'm always looking for new Oddities to add to my collection. Anything unusual, bizarre, strange, or disturbing -- bring it to me! I do pay a nominal finder's fee, but of course the real reward is your contribution to posterity.
Do you have anything that you'd like to contribute to the Museum?

plots: Roe went on a business trip to Amn
title: Mirianne's Husband
objective: tell Mirianne whether you found information about Roe or not
description:
My husband had to make a sudden business trip to Amn and I'm so worried for him.
"Mirianne," he always said, "Mirianne, who knows the road better than old Roe?" But the highways just aren't as safe as they once were and there hasn't been a messenger from Amn here in months.
Could you keep your eyes open along the southern roads and let me know if you find anything?

plots: the player has brought Sinderion a sample of Nirnroot for examination
the Elixir of Exploration requires Nirnroot
the formula for the Elixir of Exploration describes many magnitudes of the brew: Sinderion wrote a short missive about it for the Imperial Alchemy Symposium
title: Seeking Your Roots
objective: collect more Nirnroot
tasks: collect 10 samples of Nirnroot for Sinderion
description:
So, you've brought something for me to examine?
Yes, this is a genuine Nirnroot sample. Very nice quality in fact. Hmmm... that gives me an idea. Since you already know what they look like, do you feel up to a bit of a collecting expedition?
A few years ago, an adventurer not unlike yourself sold me a musty old tome containing alchemical formulas. Most of them were worthless. But one of the moldy pages contained the recipe for a potion known as an Elixir of Exploration, a sort of "ultimate dungeon delver's" brew. The formula looked sound, except it required an extremely rare ingredient. Yes, you guessed it, the Nirnroot. I put the book aside, because frankly, I had so many other delicate experiments going on that I just didn't have the time to go plant hunting. Now that you're here, that changes things.
The Elixir of Exploration is a multi-purpose potion that was obviously created with the dungeon explorer in mind. The formula describes many magnitudes of the brew. If you're interested, I wrote a short missive about it for the Imperial Alchemy Symposium. You bring me 10 samples of Nirnroot, and I'll make the Elixir of Exploration available to you at a huge discount as well as give you one for free.
The best place for you to start would be Shadeleaf Copse, which is a part of the Great Forest northeast of here. Good luck, and hurry back with more of the Nirnroot!

plots: Larina stole Pantea's flute and sold it to a necromancer
title: Pantea's Flute
objective: recover Pantea's flute for her
description:
That damn fool! I should wring Larina's neck! That fool student of mine stole my flute and sold it to some necromancer in Hob's Fall Cave.
Apparently Larina told him some story about the flute being able to make the dead dance. It's just a flute. A really old and valuable flute, but just a flute. I just got a ransom note for it. That flute has been handed down for seventeen generations!
Well don't just stand there. Go get my flute! I don't have any money to give you. but I can show you a few tricks I learned playing for wizards.

plots: the player has done assignments to Bodhi before
Palern Flynn betrayed the Shadow Thieves: the Shadow Thieves have been questioning Palern Flynn ruthlessly for some days
Palern Flynn will be killed once the Shadow Thieves are through
title: A Rescue Mission
objective: do not let the Shadow Thieves kill Palern Flynn
description:
I will give you your next assignment.
The Shadow Thieves have other enemies besides me. Recently, they uncovered a traitor, and have been questioning him quite ruthlessly for some days now.
You will rescue him. He will be killed once they are through, so go quickly. They have him at the Shadow Thief guild house on the second floor. You know the building, I think? The man's name is Palern Flynn. Remember, if he dies, you fail.
Good luck.

plots: the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Anuriel's private quarters
title: Compelling Tribute
objective: use Anuriel to gain intelligence on the Stormcloaks
tasks: find evidence about Anuriel's corrupt activities in her private quarters, and use it to blackmail her
description:
You're going to Riften. My spies report the Jarl's Steward, Anuriel, has arrangements with the Thieves Guild that would be rather embarrassing if made public.
I need you to find evidence of her corrupt activities, and use it to gain a measure of her "cooperation."
This will require stealth and discretion. The Jarl's guards won't take kindly to anyone rummaging through the steward's private quarters.

TESS181: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock
TESS184: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock

plots: Modyn Veleth's men have been stashing bottles of Emberbrand Wine: it distracts them from their tasks
title: Recipe for Distraction
objective: tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
tasks: locate the hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
description:
Modyn Veleth, Captain of the Redoran Guard at your service. Looking for something to lend a hand with? We have problems aplenty in Raven Rock.
Commanding the Redoran Guard can be a difficult task. Even the most experienced warriors can fall prey to petty distractions. They usually didn't amount to much, but they make my job that much harder. Some of my own men have become quite accustomed to a spirit they called 'Emberbrand Wine.' Despise the stuff myself. It's powerful and tremendously addicting... I've seen men fail to finish even a single flask.
If I knew where they were stashing the bottles, I'd put an end to it myself. Could you track down the stash? That would be helpful. I just don't have time to do it myself right now.
They're too smart to have left it in the Bulwark. I'd search one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of town.

plots: Galken gives the player the ward token if the player settles his bar tab
title: Galken's Wardstone
objective: get the ward token that opens the way to the labyrinths beneath Durlag's Tower from Galken
description:
I'm Galken. Hey, how'd you like to be supping on fine venison and tippin' back the good stuff?
I've the key to wealth legendary if you're up for it. No doubt you've heard of the labyrinth at Durlag's Tower, eh? And how she's been pillaged so often that fat nobles go there for picnics? Well, the TOWER has, but BELOW are dungeons untouched! I've a token, a ward token to be sure, that gives entry to them.
'Tis yours if you'll but settle my tab so I can leave this fine place... with all my limbs intact.

plots: NONE
title: Animal Extermination
objective: clear out Bleakcoast Cave for the Jarl
description:
The Jarl of Winterhold has asked for our help. It seems that predators have taken up residence in Bleakcoast Cave and have been attacking farmers and travelers.
Someone's got to head out there and take care of the beasts. Get it taken care of right away. Nobody wants a hungry animal left roaming along the roads.

plots: NONE
title: Breaking the Siege
objective: free the Guardian of Mana
tasks: fight your way past the Ezrohir to the Guardian of Mana
description:
When the Zeraphi and Ezrohir "parted ways," they designated the nearby fortress of Riftkeep as a neutral ground, where they could meet and talk over their differences. But it has remained unused for centuries... until a few weeks ago, when the Ezrohir army seized the fortress. They have occupied it ever since, and that is surely where they are holding the Guardian of Mana while they marshal their forces.
The Ezrohir will be expecting the Zeraphi to attack them at Riftkeep, to attempt to rescue the Guardian. But they know it will take time for the Zeraphi to arrive. You can get there much more quickly, and fight your way inside before they are prepared to repel you.
Go. Fight past the Ezrohir and free the Guardian!

plots: the player and Brynjolf did a little thievery at the market
title: Taking Care of Business
objective: send a message that the Thieves Guild is not to be ignored
tasks: collect some debts from Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand, and Haelga without killing them
description:
Well, well... Color me impressed kid. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!
So... now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me? They are Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand and Haelga.
They owe our organization some serious coin and they've decided not to pay. I want you to explain to them the error of their ways. Do this right, and I can promise you a permanent place in our organization.
Honestly, the debt is secondary here. What's more important is that you get the message across that we aren't to be ignored. A word of warning though... I don't want any of them killed. Bad for business.

plots: xvarts and kobolds swarmed the Nashkel mines
xvarts and kobolds have started attacking livestock more and more often
title: Xvart Raids
objective: save Hulrik's cows
tasks: kill the xvarts that are attacking the cows
description:
I'm Hulrik! You have to help me!
Them xvarts are after my cows again! Ever since them xvarts an' their kobold kin swarmed the mines at Nashkel, they've been makin' attacks like that more and more often.

plots: NONE
title: Bittneld and Emfrid
objective: help to bring Emfrid and Bittneld the Curse-Bringer together
tasks: talk to Emfrid about Bittneld the Curse-Bringer, and talk to Bittneld the Curse-Bringer about Emfrid
description:
Hello. I'm Casta Scribonia. The writer. Author of 'Woman Gone Wild'.
Who is the fairest of them all? Other than myself? Emfrid, the proprietor of the Grey Mare is lovely. She and Bittneld the Curse-Bringer, the guard captain would be a nice couple....
Perhaps you could bring them together somehow... try talking to them both about each other?

plots: Valdar has been holding Hevnoraak in his tomb
Hevnoraak's minions guard the three vessels
title: Evil in Waiting
objective: help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
tasks: collect the three vessels needed to vanquish Hevnoraak, and bring them to Valdar
description:
Leave, stranger. Evil stirs in this place. I fear for the security of the very land if it should break free.
We stand at the tomb of Hevnoraak, who has been dead for many generations. I fear, however, that his return may be at hand. I have been holding him here. While he regains strength, however, I am fading. By now I can barely contain his power, much less defeat him if he awakens. But with the help of a living champion I may be able to succeed.
Three vessels in the tomb below hold the power to vanquish Hevnoraak. Before anything else, we need those. Bring them to me - but be careful, mortal. They are guarded by Hevnoraak's minions. They will stop at nothing to see their master return.

plots: Mirili Ulven gives the player a list of plants she needs
title: Taxonomy of Obsession
objective: help Mirili Ulven finish her research
description:
I am Mirili Ulven, a botanist.
You're offering to help me with my research? Well... I suppose I could find a use for you, despite your lack of training. Collect some plants for me, will you?
Here's the list of things I need. Get me everything on it. Try to remember where you found it so you can tell me. It's important.
I will pay you 10 gold coins for each sample.

plots: NONE
title: Palin and the Monsters
objective: save people from monsters
description:
Good day to you, stranger. I'm called Palin. Excuse my, uhm, abruptness but I would ask your assistance.
Just east of this place there are monsters. They are attacking a small group of people. Please, if you have hearts, come and help me fight.

plots: NONE
title: A Few Words with You
objective: convince Mikael to leave Carlotta Valentia alone
description:
That bard Mikael is begging for a dagger up against his throat, the way he goes on about me.
I've heard him boasting at the Bannered Mare, saying he'll "conquer me as a true warrior conquers any harsh beast." Hmph.
You could try to convince that lute player to stop chasing me. If you want to try, go right ahead. I don't think anything will get through that thick skull of his, though.
If you do convince Mikael, I'd thank the gods, but I'll settle for thanking you. There'll be some coin for your help.

BG1277: along the west coast of Balduran's Isle

plots: Evan sought out the Blue Lady and disappeared
Evalt thinks that Evan is under the Blue Lady's spell
title: Evalt's Missing Brother
objective: find Evan
description:
I am Evalt, I fish for clan in these savage waters. Listen, outsider, may I ask you for help?
There is a witch on this isle. My brother called her the Blue Lady and those of us who ply these waters have all heard her singing at one time or another. My brother, Evan, heard her more than most. I think that he went to find her. I think that he is under her spell. I must go and find him. This witch might kill him. He is strong but he is under her spell. I fear that she will kill him before he realizes what is happening. Can you find my brother?
I don't know exactly where the Blue Lady is. I have the sense to avoid her, unlike Evan. But I have only heard her singing along the west coast of the island.

plots: the player told Kodlak Whitemane that they want to join the Companions
title: Take Up Arms
objective: prove that you are worthy of joining the Companions
tasks: go with Vilkas out to the yard, and let him see what you can do
description:
You would like to join the Companions? Would you now? Here, let me have a look at you. Hm. Yes, perhaps. A certain strength of spirit.
How are you in a battle, child? Don't feel like you need to show off for our sake. Vilkas, here, will be the one testing your mettle.
Let Vilkas take you out to the yard and see what you can do.

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
Endon ordered a silver mold from Valenwood: it was stolen by a group of bandits led by Rigel Strong-Arm
the authorities told Endon that their resources were spread too thin right now
title: Silver Lining
objective: recover Endon's stolen silver mold for him
description:
Several months ago I ordered a special silver mold from some artisans in Valenwood. Well, it never arrived. Later I found out that it was robbed by a group of bandits led by someone named Rigel Strong-Arm.
Look, I talked to everyone with an ounce of authority... everyone. They all told me their resources were spread too thin right now. Word on the street says that the Thieves Guild is coming back into its own in Markarth so I figured... ...to send a thief to steal back what was stolen.
Look, this mold is irreplaceable. I'll pay you well for its return and I can also prove to be quite a valuable ally to the Thieves Guild.  The only thing I can tell you is that the mold was taken to the bandit's hideout... a small cottage called Pinewatch.
I'm not sure how many men they have inside, but I trust that won't be an issue for you. Good luck.

plots: the player asked Helvius Cecia to give them Hand to Hand training
Helvius Cecia will not throw a single punch during the sparring match
the rules of the sparring match: 1) the player must not reach for a weapon, 2) Helvius Cecia will tell the player to stop if they hurt him or if the match goes on for too long
title: Hand to Hand Training
objective: prove Helvius Cecia that you deserve his training
tasks: have a sparring match with Helvius Cecia
description:
Hand to Hand training, eh? The real question is, can you fight?
You know, throw a good punch? Can you? I'd like to find out if I'm going to spend time working with you. So are you up for a sparring match?
I'll make it easy on you. I won't throw a single punch. I just want to see what you've got, anyway. So, is it a deal?
If I see you reach for a weapon, I'm calling it off. And if you can actually hurt me, I'll tell you to stop. If this goes on for too long, and I get bored, I'll stop you.
Now show me what you've got!

plots: Chelak found "Spider's Bane"
Chelak went to Cloakwood to clear the spider colony with "Spider's Bane"
title: Spiders in the Cloakwood
objective: investigate what happened to Chelak
description:
He-hello, travelers. I'm Tiber. Could... could I take up some of your time? I would be very grateful if you would just listen to... if you would just help me!
It's my brother, you see. He and I went into the Cloakwood to clear the woods of the spider colony that infests it. I know it sounds foolish... but my brother had found the sword "Spider's Bane"! The sword was created to kill spiders... and we thought we could become famous... the heroes of Cloakwood, and all that. But my brother hasn't returned yet... and it's been more than a week.
Please, could you go into the woods and find him for me? His name's Chelak. My mother would be so shattered if Chelak were to be dead.

plots: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire to teach them how to enchant weapons and armor
learning an enchantment from an item destroys the item
Farengar Secret-Fire can sell the player everything they need
title: The Joy of Enchanting
objective: use an Arcane Enchanter and a filled soul gem to enchant something
tasks: take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor and use an Arcane Enchanter to learn its enchantment
description:
Ah, a student of the craft. You'll need to start by learning an enchantment.
Take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor, then use the Arcane Enchanter to learn its secrets. The item is destroyed in the process, so be wary. Once you know an enchantment, you'll need a filled soul gem, and something to enchant. You'll use the Arcane Enchanter for that, too.
Of course I have everything you need for sale, if you have the coin.

plots: the player freed Guardian of Mana from her enslavement by beating some sense into her
title: Freedom!
objective: leave Riftkeep with the Guardian of Mana
tasks: enter the portal to Zeryphesh that the Guardian of Mana opens for you
description:
Stop. Enough. You have freed me from my enslavement and I am myself once more!
We must leave this place. I will open a portal for you, to Zeryphesh.

plots: the player tried to take the mace on Molag Bal's shrine: Molag Bal imprisoned the player with sharp spikes
title: Dominion and Humiliation
objective: help Molag Bal take revenge upon a priest of Boethiah who desecrated Molag Bal's shrine
tasks: save the priest of Boethiah from imprisonment
description:
Fool! Did you think Molag Bal, the Lord of Domination, would so easily reward you? What do you see from that little cage? Speak.
You definitely see the spikes of your cage. Sharp, aren't they? This was the last thing many saw before they were sacrificed in my name. But even a god has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. So long since it's tasted blood. Until you came.
I want submission. I want the priest who did this to bend his knee and give me his soul. He comes by to perform Boethiah's insulting rites at my altar, but he's been missing. Captured and bound. Left to rot.
You'll get the freedom your kind enjoys so much. Save the priest. Let him perform his rite one more time. And when he does, we will be waiting for him.
Then you will be finally rewarded. The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal. When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.

plots: the player asked Serana why she was sealed inside a tomb
Serana and her father don't get along
title: Homecoming
objective: help Serana back to Castle Volkihar
tasks: find a boat that takes you and Serana to Castle Volkihar
description:
That's... complicated. And I'm not totally sure if I can trust you. But if you want to know the whole story, help me get back to my family's home.
My family used to live on an island to the west of Solitude. Not the most welcoming place, but depending on whose around, I'll be safe there. My father and I don't really get along. Ugh, saying it out loud makes it sound so... common. "Little girl who doesn't get along with her father." Read that story a hundred times.
Hopefully we can find a boat to take us to my family's home.

BG1215: Ragefast's house, in the northwest part of the town

plots: Ragefast enslaved the nymph
Ragefast locked the nymph inside Ragefast's house
title: The Captive Nymph
objective: investigate Ragefast and his nymph
description:
You may call me Lady Hannah. Ragefast! Oh, he makes me seethe! He's a mage on a power trip and what does he do?
He acquires his own personal nymph and enslaves her in his quarters! Seek him out and look into this matter immediately! His house is in the northwest part of town.
I wish you luck and all the passion of my fury in your task.

plots: NONE
title: Unfathomable Depths
objective: take the Lexicon from From-Deepest-Fathoms, and free her from her burden
tasks: return the Lexicon back to Avanchnzel
description:
You. You must take the Lexicon. Free me of my burden.
The memories. I cannot stand them. You must take them away, return them to Avanchnzel.
You must take the Lexicon from me. Please... take it now. You must bring it to Avanchnzel, in the west. Return it to them. It must go back.

plots: the player asked Fethis Alor whether he sells special mining gear: he does not
title: Pain in the Necklace
objective: bring East Empire Pendants to Fethis Alor
description:
Mining gear? No. However, I used to sell East Empire Pendants until I ran out of them. Popular little item.
It's an amulet that was made exclusively for the East Empire Company. They gave them to their workers as an incentive at one point... a kind of reward for extra effort. They're no longer being made, so they've become collectible. I'd love to get my hands on a few of them.
They could be anywhere on the island. The mines might be a good place to start. If you find any while you're exploring Solstheim, bring them here and I'll pay you for them.

plots: NONE
title: Ash Research
objective: extract a sample from an ash spawn for Neloth's research
tasks: kill an ash spawn and harvest a sample from it
description:
Hmm. I have a new spell I'm working on. I hope to be able to conjure ash spawn.
If I could get a sample of ash from an ash spawn, that would be quite useful. I've made this special tool that will extract... well, you don't need to know the details. Just go harvest a sample.
Of course, the creature will have to be dead first, but I trust that's something you can... bring about. There will be some septims for your troubles.

plots: NONE
title: Heartfire
objective: recover the Heartfire Stone for yourself
tasks: claim the key to Vyrax's Tower
description:
Hello again! I think I may be able to repay the favor you've done for us.
I've been doing some research, and have uncovered some interesting information about Vyrax, the ancient dragon who still dwells in the tower in Rivenskull Gorge.
The interesting bit is this - Vyrax has amidst his hoard a Heartfire Stone, which confers to its wielder the power of dragonfire. It is a rare and powerful artifact that would surely aid you.
If you wish to find the Heartfire Stone, you will need to first claim the key to Vyrax's Tower, in the depths of the Forgotten Halls.
Good luck!

plots: J'zargo gives the player plenty of flame cloak scrolls
title: J'zargo's Experiment
objective: help J'zargo test his new spells
tasks: use J'zargo's flame cloak scrolls against undead, and report back to J'zargo whether they work
description:
Can you... can you possibly help J'zargo? You must be very skilled with magic, yes? J'zargo is working hard, but cannot do it alone.
J'zargo has worked hard on learning new spells, trying new things. This will make J'zargo stand out as a mage. But J'zargo works so hard, there is no time to test these new spells.
If you help with the testing, this will make learning easier. J'zargo will give you scrolls, you will use them and report the results. This is a good plan, no? Let's see... this one, I think. J'zargo has designed it to be an excellent flame cloak, with a twist. It is especially potent against the undead, and should burn them to a crisp in no time. J'zargo gives you plenty of these scrolls, so you try them and return when you can say whether they work.

plots: Arkved stole the Orb from the the dreams of Vaermina's followers: in the Orb, Arkved has found more than he bargained for
title: Vaermina's Orb of Nightmares
objective: retrieve the Orb
description:
We meet again, mortal, for we have met before, whether you know it or not.
When you mutter in your sleep, you speak to me. When you waken wet with sweat, you've just left my house. I dwell in your dreams; I savor your nightmares. Now, you will serve me.
The wizard Arkved has the Orb of Vaermina... snatched from the dreams of my followers and dragged into the waking world. Travel to his tower and retrieve my Orb. Take care, though, mortal. In the Orb, Arkved has found more than he bargained for.
After proving yourself, mortal, you shall bear my token, the Skull of Corruption.

plots: NONE
title: Ashes to Eternity
objective: deliver Berit's ashes to Runil, the priest of Arkay
description:
Falkreath is known for its graveyard, traveler. We've buried more dead than you can imagine.
I just finished giving my old war companion, Berit, a proper burial by fire. Old hard head hated the idea of being lost cold in the ground.
Could you deliver the ashes to Runil, the priest of Arkay? He'll know the right blessings to make for Berit's soul.

plots: Ike Cascadion Vendar is leading a tour to Durlag's Tower
the tour to Durlag's Tower costs 60 gold
title: A Tour of Durlag's Tower
objective: take a tour to Durlag's Tower
tasks: buy a tour to Durlag's Tower from Ike Cascadion Vendar
description:
Step right up folks and HEAR the tale of dread placed before thee. Join with me as I, adventurer extraordinaire Ike Cascadion Vendar, lead yet another group of brave souls through the very SEAT of danger in the realms. To Durlag's Tower we shall go, and witness the perils that have taken the lives of hundreds of courageous men and women.
SEE the horror of the treacherous traps! FEEL the presence of the long languishing dead! MARVEL at the wondrous wealth buried below! NOT for the weak of spirit as I will NOT be held accountable for any heart failure during OR after our expedition! Step up, step up! One at a TIME!
A special package deal of 60 gold for you, not that you would need a discount.

plots: Brynjolf will cause a distraction
title: A Chance Arrangement
objective: put Brand-Shei out of the business permanently
tasks: tell Brynjolf when you are ready, steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand, and place Madesi's silver ring in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing
description:
I've got a bit of an errand to perform, but I need an extra pair of hands. And in my line of work, extra hands are well-paid.
It's simple... I'm going to cause a distraction and you're going to steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand. Once you have it, I want you to place it in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing.
There's someone that wants to see Brand-Shei put out of business permanently. That's all you need to know. Now, you tell me when you're ready and we'll get started.

plots: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one Demented and other Manic
Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there is a law about that and the Hill of Suicides is not a nice place
title: A Serious Split
objective: resolve the issue with duplicate citizens
tasks: kill the manic citizens of Split
description:
Talking wears me, Horkvir Bear-Arm, out.
My double is always working. It takes all my energy just watching him work. It's got to stop. It's a problem, all these doubles walking around. And it's tiresome. Didn't used to be like this.
Some blasted mage. Had a theory. They've always got theories. He thought there was a Manic and a Demented in each of us. So, what does he do? What else? Casts a spell. You can see how well that went. Two of each of us walking around this place. Nothing we can do about it, either. There's a law about that here. Been to the Hill of Suicides? Not a nice place. But you might be able to help.
Only one group can stick around. Either we Demented or those blasted Manics. It's the only way we'll find any peace. You get rid of those Manics. All of them. If you can take care of that for me, I'd make it worth your while..

plots: the player entered the pocket plane via a rope
a lich has the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men
killing or not killing the lich is up to the player
killing the lich allows the player to loot the tower
once the player has the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men, the player will be brought back to the headquarters with a rope by Jarlaxle
title: Intrigue with Jarlaxle
objective: give the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men to Jarlaxle
tasks: find the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men
description:
I am Jarlaxle, leader of the Bregan D'aerthe, at your service.
This is a pocket plane, headquarters of the Bregan D'aerthe, my mercenary band. I hoped the rope would bring you here, and I see that it has. Welcome!
There is a lich who has numerous gems that contain the souls of my men, and I want them back. Whether you kill the lich or not is up to you. Killing him would allow you to loot the tower, I suppose, but however you get those gems is of no concern to me.
Once you gather up the gems, I will use the rope to pull you back into the headquarters here. Easy enough, yes?
You shall receive a bit of gold, my friend, for your trouble.

plots: Laerta and Louise are twin sisters
title: Laerta and Louise
objective: get rid of a bogeyman that scares Laerta and Louise every night
description:
Hi! I'm Laerta. That's my twin sister, Louise.
Mom and Dad don't believe us, but there's a bogeyman that comes and looks in our window every night. We're real glad we're twins because, if there were only one of us, then there'd be no one to hold on to when we get scared. Scare away the bogeyman, would you?
Mom says to give this scroll as a reward. I think it's supposed to protect you from any other bogeypeople you find.

TESO527: one of Boethia's realms in Oblivion

plots: the player has summoned Boethia: the player is not a worshiper of Boethia
Boethia shall open a portal for the player to one of his realms in Oblivion
if the player fails the Tournament of Ten Bloods, the player's soul belongs to Boethia
title: Boethia's Bloody Tournament
objective: prove your worthiness to Boethia in the Tournament of Ten Bloods
tasks: survive the Tournament of Ten Bloods
description:
Why do you summon Boethia? You are not one of my faithful.
Do you hope to be counted among my Chosen? Then prove yourself to me, mortal. I shall open a portal for you to one of my realms in Oblivion. Go, and take your place in my Tournament of Ten Bloods.
Survive, and you will be rewarded with my glorious sword Goldbrand. Fail, and your soul belongs to me.
